result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs), Dist/Deliver Drugs On/Near School], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO THIS CASE:  Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharges.  Pay court costs and victim witness surcharges.  To be paid from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by the end of Extended supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Full time employment or school.  Obtain a GED/HSED.
No alcohol or controlled substances. No contact with any drug users or Arroya L.
Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louis R Santana-Delgado

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment, signed and filed.
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, calendar successor, for review. mag
Count four (Return Address:  Louis R. Santana-Delgado #616369, Columbia Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 900, Portage, WI  53901).
Defendant's petition for sentence adjustment on count four was returned because he has not served the applicable percentage of confinement time on this court pursuant to section 973.195, Stats.
Brenda Barthlomew sworn to interpret this date.

Defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

AS TO COUNT 3:
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.
:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 1/2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 103 days.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by the end of extended supervision period; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by the end of extended supervion period; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-No contact with any drug users
-No contact with Arroya L
-Full time Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Obtain a GED/HSED

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.


AS TO COUNT 4:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 1/2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for zero days.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by the end of extended supervision period; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by the end of extended supervion period; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-No contact with any drug users
-No contact with Arroya L
-Full time Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Obtain a GED/HSED

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGES:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms or body armor.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado in court with attorney Caitlin Firer for Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Laura Crivello.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JUDGE DONALD, BRANCH 2 FOR JUDGE POCAN, BRANCH 26.

COUNT 1:  POSSESSION WITH INTENT TO DELIVER CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE (COCAINE) (>5-15 GRAMS) - PTAC, AS A PARTY TO A CRIME, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON, POSSESSION WITH INTENT TO DELIVER/DISTRIBUTE A CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE ON OR NEAR A SCHOOL contrary to Wis. Stats. Sec. 961.41(1m)(cm)2, 939.50(3)(e), 939.05, 939.63(1)(b), 961.49(1m)(b)6, a Class E Felony.

COUNT 2:  POSSESSION WITH INTENT TO DELIVER CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE (HEROIN) (3 GRAMS OR LESS) - PTAC, AS A PARTY TO A CRIME, POSSESSION WITH INTENT TO DELIVER/DISTRIBUTE A CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE ON OR A NEAR A SCHOOL, USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON contrary to Wis. Stats. Sec. 961.41.(1m)(d)1, 939.50(3)(f), 939.05, 961.49(1m)(b)6, 939.63(1)(b), a Class F Felony.
Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Barthalomew.  Filed by the state:  Proposed Jury instructions, Motion in Limine, Witness List.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 5-19-14, 9:00 a.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by the Defense:  Motion to Suppress Statements.
Filed by the Defense:  Motion in Limine, Proposed Jury Instructions, Motion for Supplemental Discovery.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing FEBRUARY 18, 2014  received and filed. (16 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Anne Jaspers - SPD  819 N 6th Street  9th Floor  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Attorney Anne M. Jaspers in court, defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado not in court, in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado in court with attorney Anne Jaspers and Ciatlin Firer.  Defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Enrique Barbosa.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Abner Valcarcel-MPD Detective.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CO-DEF: DAVID ARROYO-LOPEZ.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Sworn as interpreter:  CHRISTINA GREEN.

Defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Louis R Santana-Delgado in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
